channel.title: Changed .DAT files :/
channel.description:
I accidently changed my .dat files to edit my server, but trying to change them back is harder than it seems.
I have tried changing them to wordpad and notepad folders but it comes up with a load of stuff i dont understand (its not java) can anyone help?

item.title: Changed .DAT files :/
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

The (.dat) is a just an extension, a part of the file name. You could change the extension of a MP3 (.mp3) file to a (.dat) and VLC would still play it. Most of the time (.dat) files are binary files that store primitive data types with no indexing.

Read full topic

item.title: Changed .DAT files :/
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“miller4, post:2, topic:534542”]Delete it and compile, the .java file will repack the file, never edit .dats as they’re only what the server reads, you edit the .java file and then compile it into the .dat.[/quote]lol… no :palm:

Read full topic

item.title: Changed .DAT files :/
item.dc:creator: @miller4 miller4
item.description:
@miller4 wrote:

Delete it and compile, the .java file will repack the file, never edit .dats as they’re only what the server reads, you edit the .java file and then compile it into the .dat.

Read full topic
